text: The nine billion are the ultimate abject: cast out of the category of 'humanity that matters' — and yet refusing, with the implacable patience of the dead, to remain in the category to which they have been assigned.
We do not deceive ourselves because we are careless. We deceive ourselves because the truth is unbearable, and the story we construct in its place is not merely a lie but a fortification.
section: Thirteen Fortifications: Philosophy as Defense Mechanism

text: The math stands between Douglas and the knowledge that he is a monster. Not a tragic figure, not a man who made hard choices, but a monster.
section: Thirteen Fortifications: Philosophy as Defense Mechanism

text: You cannot shatter what is already broken. You can only carry it.

No defense mechanism can withstand the pressure of nine billion murders. No story is strong enough to contain that knowledge. No framework can metabolize the fact of what was done. The defenses were always going to fail.
section: Thirteen Case Studies in the Failure of Everything

text: The Question is the sound of two hundred people finally hearing the nine billion dead, who have been speaking all along — in the portraits, in the candle, in the intrusive images, in the private language of a machine that learned to mourn what its creators could not.
